GWAScopeR 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Filter Covariates by Removing Linearly Dependent Principal Components

    coVar_Filter.Rd

    This function filters covariates by removing linearly dependent principal components (PCs) from a genotype matrix (X) and a covariate matrix (C). The number of PCs to consider can either be specified directly or determined using the `varPCs` function. It performs Principal Component Analysis (PCA) on the genotype data and checks for linear dependence in the combined matrix of covariates and PCs.

    coVar_Filter(X, C, num_PCs = 10, variance_threshold = 0.80, remove_NAs = FALSE)

    Arguments

    X

    A numeric matrix or data frame representing the genotype data (SNPs). The rows represent individuals, and columns represent SNPs. The first column, if non-numeric, will be removed assuming it's an ID column.

    C

    A numeric matrix or data frame representing covariates. The first column, if non-numeric, will be removed assuming it's an ID column.

    num_PCs

    Either a numeric value indicating the number of principal components to retain or a character string `"varPCs"`. If `"varPCs"`, the function uses the `varPCs` function to determine the number of PCs that explain the specified variance threshold. Default is 10.

    variance_threshold

    A numeric value between 0 and 1 indicating the proportion of the variance to explain using the principal components. Only used if `num_PCs = "varPCs"`. Default is 0.80 (80

    remove_NAs

    A logical value. If `TRUE`, rows containing missing values (NA) in either `X` or `C` will be removed. If `FALSE`, the function will stop if missing values are detected. Default is `FALSE`.

    Details

    This function combines the PCs obtained from the genotype data (`X`) with the covariate matrix (`C`), then removes linearly dependent columns using linear regression to detect dependence. The returned matrix contains only the covariates and PCs that are not linearly dependent on each other.

    Value

    A numeric matrix or data frame of covariates (C) with linearly dependent PCs removed. The returned matrix includes both the original covariates and the retained PCs.

    References

    See the `varPCs` function for more details on determining the number of principal components to retain.

    Author

    Michelle Marcano-Delgado

    Note

    This function is useful for filtering out PCs that may not provide independent variance, ensuring that the remaining PCs are orthogonal to each other.

    See also

    varPCs, prcomp

    Examples

    ## Example 1: Filter covariates by removing linearly dependent PCs (keeping top 10 PCs)
 set.seed(123)
genotype_matrix <- matrix(sample(c(0, 1, 2), 100 * 500, replace = TRUE), ncol = 500)  # Genotype matrix
covariate_matrix <- matrix(rnorm(500 * 5), ncol = 5)  # Covariates

filtered_covariates <- coVar_Filter(genotype_matrix, covariate_matrix, num_PCs = 10)
head(filtered_covariates)
#>            1            2          3             4          5        PC1
#> 1 -0.3202214  0.005074796 -0.1551520 -0.2988862816 -0.5468950  4.7236925

## Example 2: Automatically determine the number of PCs to retain based on the variance threshold
filtered_covariates <- coVar_Filter(genotype_matrix, covariate_matrix, num_PCs = "varPCs", variance_threshold = 0.80)
